>>The Rule of 70 is used to calculate the:<< () global population growth rate () crude birth rate () crude death rate (x) doubling time
[explanation]
The rule of 70 refers to the formula used to calculate doubling time, or the amount of time it would take for a population to double in size. The formula is as follows: Doubling time = 70 / growth rate of the population
